forget.notes: Remove entries when /forget text matches any field (case-insensitive substring).

auto_extract_hints.when_enabled: Extract candidate memories from user messages and propose insertions using the same schema.

memories.summary: Wants to learn Postman from the basics.

memories.summary: Continuing GatherTown project; backend works; frontend uses Axios; testing with Postman/cURL.
memories.embedding_text: Chip is continuing the GatherTown project where the backend works and the frontend can send API requests using Axios; he learned to use Postman and cURL to test Axios and plans to continue building and fixing the frontend.

memories.summary: School final project partially on old Zorin NVMe; Fedora drive lost most; GitHub exists; redo frontend.
memories.embedding_text: Chip's school final project was partially saved on an old Zorin NVMe drive (backend + some frontend). The new Fedora drive lost most of the project. The project exists on GitHub and he aims to redo the frontend.
aliases: Recover final project from Zorin NVMe

memories.summary: Building LUCI (Lucid Luci) — a local Jarvis-style AI agent with Telegram, web UI, voice, email/calendar, memory, and multi-model routing. GitHub: equansa00/lucid-luci.
memories.embedding_text: Chip is building LUCI (Lucid Luci), a fully local personal AI agent running on his Fedora Threadripper. Features: Telegram bot, FastAPI web UI on port 7860, Piper TTS, Whisper STT, openwakeword wake word, Gmail/Calendar integration, persistent memory (beast_memory.json), and multi-model Ollama routing (chat/code/reasoning/deep/agent).

memories.summary: Adding GitHub integration to LUCI — auto-scan all 30+ repos, LLM code review, autonomous fixes, PR pipeline.
memories.embedding_text: Chip is adding GitHub integration to LUCI that scans all his GitHub repos (30+, mix of React/Next.js web apps, Python backends, personal projects), generates LLM code reviews using qwen2.5-coder:7b, and autonomously opens PRs with fixes via a beast/fixes branch.

memories.summary: LUCI runs as 4 systemd user services: luci (Telegram bot), luci-web (FastAPI :7860), luci-briefing (8am daily), luci-wake (wake word).
memories.embedding_text: Chip's LUCI agent runs as systemd user services on his Fedora Threadripper: luci.service (Telegram bot), luci-web.service (FastAPI web UI on port 7860, LAN IP 172.16.28.207), luci-briefing.timer (daily 8am briefing), luci-wake.service (openwakeword daemon).

memories.summary: LUCI voice stack: Piper TTS (en_US-lessac-medium), Whisper STT (base.en), openwakeword (hey_jarvis model mapped to Hey LUCI).
memories.embedding_text: LUCI's voice stack uses Piper TTS with the en_US-lessac-medium model for speech output, OpenAI Whisper base.en for speech-to-text transcription, and openwakeword with the hey_jarvis_v0.1 model mapped to the Hey LUCI wake phrase. Custom Hey LUCI model training is planned.

memories.summary: LUCI auto-routes to best model: chat→llama3.1:8b, code→qwen2.5-coder:7b, reasoning→deepseek-r1:8b, deep→beast70b:latest, agent→llama3.1:70b.
memories.embedding_text: LUCI uses keyword-based model routing: chat and summaries go to llama3.1:8b, code tasks to qwen2.5-coder:7b, reasoning questions to deepseek-r1:8b, deep architectural tasks to beast70b:latest, and agent loop tasks always use llama3.1:70b.

memories.summary: Threadripper AI server runs Fedora; prefers Docker as the default going forward.
memories.embedding_text: Chip's Threadripper AI server runs Fedora and he prefers using Docker; treat this as the default going forward.
aliases: Fedora + Docker default for AI server

memories.embedding_text: Chip is exploring budget-friendly camera intercom options for a three-family property; one intercom wiring run exists but needs the unit replaced, and two other runs need wiring fished out.

memories.summary: Building smart home; has Ecobee; wants UniFi-compatible floodlight.
memories.embedding_text: Chip wants to turn his house into a smart home and already has an Ecobee thermostat; he is looking for a floodlight compatible with UniFi systems.

memories.summary: Planning basement home theater + kids area while keeping laundry/storage; in-laws moving in.
memories.embedding_text: Chip plans to convert the basement into a home theater and play area for the kids while maintaining laundry and storage, especially since his in-laws will be moving in and taking up additional space.
aliases: Keep laundry/storage while adding play area

memories.embedding_text: Chip wants to perform a full forensic-level purge by reflashing GrapheneOS using Brave and is aware that this may result in loss of eSIM access.

memories.embedding_text: Chip is using a Pixel PXL Pro with GrapheneOS and has two user profiles set up.

memories.embedding_text: Chip is using GrapheneOS with ChatGPT and it is working well for him.

memories.summary: Bitwarden recovery resolved. Had documented export + GPG + VeraCrypt workflow.
memories.embedding_text: Chip resolved his Bitwarden recovery situation. He had a workflow for export, encryption, and storage using GPG and VeraCrypt.

memories.summary: Wants step-by-step plan for deGoogled ROM on Xperia 5 III (LineageOS+microG preferred).
memories.embedding_text: Chip wants a step-by-step install plan for a deGoogled Android OS on the Sony Xperia 5 III, ideally LineageOS + microG or CalyxOS if available.

memories.summary: Plans to test Xperia 5 III stock ROM first, then backup and install LineageOS+microG.
memories.embedding_text: Chip plans to test the Sony Xperia 5 III with the stock ROM first, then back up and install LineageOS with microG.
aliases: Test stock first then LineageOS microG

memories.summary: Wants to debloat S24 Ultra by removing Google + Samsung bloatware via ADB.
memories.embedding_text: Chip is using a Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra (global model) and wants to debloat it by removing both Google and Samsung bloatware using ADB.

memories.summary: Building privacy-first Android OS as custom ROM with Hidden Spaces; wants AOSP + headless Cuttlefish first.
memories.embedding_text: Chip is building a privacy-first Android OS as a custom ROM with Hidden Spaces (non-enumerable profiles and discovery unlock). He wants step-by-step setup for AOSP builds and a headless Cuttlefish emulator first, then device builds.

memories.summary: Has Mega.nz, Intranxt, unstable TrueNAS Scale, and 24TB HDD for backups.
memories.embedding_text: Chip has Mega.nz, Intranxt, a barely working TrueNAS Scale, and a 24TB HDD for backups.

memories.summary: Wants full encrypted system backup; redownload old Fedora files from Mega; backup current Fedora to Mega + 24TB.
memories.embedding_text: Chip wants a full encrypted system backup, to redownload his original Fedora files from Mega.nz, and to back up his current Fedora system to Mega.nz and a 24TB HDD.
aliases: Encrypted Fedora backup to Mega and 24TB

memories.summary: Traveled to Nigeria for 2 weeks with wife and 3 kids; planned Starlink unlimited for one month.
memories.embedding_text: Chip traveled to Nigeria for two weeks with his wife and three kids and planned to get unlimited data Starlink for one month to stay connected while moving around.
